title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 05 June 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:39 <jvdrean> has quit  
00:48 <ries> I think I am doing something stupid, how do I upload an image?  
00:48 <@cjd> attach it as a normal attachment  
00:48 <ries> When I click the 'upload image' button, nothing happens. Trying drag and drop just show the image in the browser  
00:49 <@cjd> ahh are you trying to upload it in the WYSIWYG editor?  
00:49 <ries> yeaa  
00:49 <@cjd> I don't know that much about the WYSIWYG unfortunately  
00:50 <ries> No problem… i can use the attach method just fine  
00:50 <@cjd> You can ask about it on the list or ask mflorea when he's around but I use attach.  
00:51 <ries> I just attached a svg, and shown using the wysiwyg editor..  
01:47 <ssavi> has quit  
01:59 <ssavi> has joined #xwiki  
04:53 <ssavi> has quit  
05:15 <sdumitriu> has quit  
06:40 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
07:03 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
07:05 <Denis1> has quit  
08:06 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:10 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:14 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:15 <vmassol> has quit  
08:32 <rrodriguez> has quit  
08:34 <tekzilla> has quit  
08:36 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
08:45 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:03 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
09:08 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:28 <Inge-> Good morning  
09:29 <Inge-> If I want to display code snippets on an xwiki page, do I need a plugin, or is it easy enough to make it look decent using only standard xwiki syntax?  
09:29 <jvdrean> has quit  
09:30 <Inge-> {{code language = ... }} perhaps  
09:33 <Inge-> but not for C#  
09:41 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:42 <+tmortagne> Inge-: Hi, yes to best way to display a snippet is to use code macro  
09:42 <+tmortagne> and i'm pretty sure C# is supported  
09:42 <Inge-> hm. maybe not with "C#" as the string?  
09:43 <Inge-> java and clojure work fine  
09:43 <+tmortagne> the code macro support everything listed on http://pygments.org/languages/  
09:43 <+tmortagne> not sure what is the string to use  
09:43 <+tmortagne> let me check  
09:43 <Inge-> csharp it seems  
09:43 <+tmortagne> yes probably  
09:43 <+tmortagne> I guess pygments only support names with "fancy" characters  
09:43 <+tmortagne> without  
09:44 <Inge-> I found only bits and pieces of code sinppets support when using google: http://www.google.co.uk/search?q=xwiki+code+snippets+formatting  
09:46 <+tmortagne> Inge-: http://www.google.co.uk/search?q=xwiki+code+snippets ;)  
09:46 <+tmortagne> were close  
09:47 <Inge-> Heh. Blaming my google skillz? :P  
09:47 <Inge-> pygments has lots of support it seems :)  
09:48 <+tmortagne> yep it's very impressive  
09:48 <+tmortagne> that's why we use it even if it's Python library (we use Jython to execute it)  
09:50 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <Inge-> any thoughts on performance when having many code snippets on a page?  
09:52 <+tmortagne> to be tested but we have some pages on xwiki.org with lots of snippets  
09:53 <+tmortagne> but very big snippets can be expansive  
09:53 <+tmortagne> expensive  
09:53 <+tmortagne> see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Scripting for example  
09:54 <+tmortagne> Inge-: you can also put all theses snippets inside a cache macro to be safe  
09:55 <+tmortagne> see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Cache+Macro  
09:55 <Inge-> Great tips. Thanks.  
09:56 <Inge-> I'm authoring a developer handbook for our new distributed development teams - and xwiki seems like a good choice of tool for the purpose.  
09:57 <+tmortagne> I would say yes but I'm (strangely) a bit biased ;)  
09:58 <Inge-> who would have thought!  
09:58 <Inge-> I would expect you to have investigated other wikis before starting on this project however.  
09:59 <+tmortagne> yea I used to use mostly dokuwiki  and a bit mediawiki (through wikipedia) before starting to work on XWiki  
10:00 <Inge-> I could have told you that XWiki was a better platform :P  
10:00 <Inge-> I haven't really looked at them much, but the syntax and the wysiwyg editor of xwiki are great bonuses  
10:01 <+tmortagne> yep  
10:01 <+tmortagne> I was using dokuwiki because you can hadly find lighter wiki you can put on pretty much all free hosting, but that was before XWiki Cloud ;)  
10:03 <Inge-> I was also fairly impressed with the speed of XWiki. Hope I can keep it snappy when content grows.  
10:04 <Inge-> And I should probably try to write something up regarding styling it - that was not trivial. I've changed/uploaded logo.png files half a dozen times/places before I got it to change the logo :) It is starting to fall into place, but I stil don't feel I have a good understanding of how that stuff works (and I know crap all about css - which doesn't help \*cough\*)  
10:07 <+tmortagne> Inge-: not skin expert but you can do all sort of customization in the color theme including logo I think  
10:08 <+tmortagne> about speed you can also look at http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Performances is you did not already seen it  
10:08 <Inge-> right, thanks.  
10:15 <rrodriguez> has quit  
10:17 <Inge-> Hm. is it possible to have an xwiki link to another page inside a code block?  
10:17 <+sburjan> Hello devs. can someone upgrade to the latest Selenium 2 version because I am unable to start ui-tests on IE9 and the selenium guys told me I get a better stacktrace using the newest version  
10:18 <+sburjan> it is a known issue  
10:18 <+tmortagne> Inge-: no, code block is by definition verbatim  
10:18 <+tmortagne> s/block/macro/  
10:18 <Inge-> mumble... ok :)  
10:29 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:30 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:48 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:51 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:06 <CIA-117> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r889931d https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/889931de3fa11c2e097c180ff82584bd5e62f2e6 / pom.xml : XCOMMONS-186: Upgrade to Selenium 2.22 - http://git.io/bxMvOA  
11:08 <CIA-117> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* rf308d2d https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/f308d2d2de5d437ddf8f9a73527ba13a4ad75853 / pom.xml : [misc] Update parent after incrementing the version. - http://git.io/9uRIGg  
11:10 <CIA-117> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* rdb187f6 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/db187f69283caec6d94820064420c0b6d859917d / pom.xml : [misc] Update the parent version after incrementing the xwiki-enterprise version. - http://git.io/0OI4gg  
11:11 <+tmortagne> cjd: you forgot to update the parent versions after creating the branches  
11:11 <CIA-117> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r8aa4d8d https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/8aa4d8d7984b5b15988ebcdf88ed4de8b8c33926 / pom.xml : [misc] Update parent version after incrementing xwiki-rendering version. - http://git.io/lj1YMg  
11:12 <+tmortagne> (looks like mflorea is taking care of it)  
11:13 <+mflorea> yep, I upgraded selenium and I didn't understood why the new version is not taken into account :)  
11:17 <+sburjan> thanks mflorea  !! :)  
11:20 <+mflorea> sburjan: ;)  
11:34 <CIA-117> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* rdfa9622 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-manager/commit/dfa9622b00c46496b3fac62b8f12dd25940bcc24 / pom.xml : [misc] Update parent version after incrementing xwiki-manager version. - http://git.io/L6ymJw  
11:40 <jvdrean1> has joined #xwiki  
11:43 <jvdrean> has quit  
11:50 <vmassol> cjd: ping  
11:59 <CIA-117> Marius Dumitru Florea stable-4.1.x \* r55e009b https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/55e009bd0523f261cc35c1123601e0c4511b1bc5 / (30 files in 13 dirs): Merge branch 'feature-diff-display' into stable-4.1.x (+14 more commits...) - http://git.io/uGU1zQ  
11:59 <CIA-117> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* ra43ad56 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/a43ad5637299a77eacc5b4dab7e6ac7807a6d612 / xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-diff/xwiki-commons-diff-display/pom.xml : [misc] Increment version. (+15 more commits...) - https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/a43ad5637299a77eacc5b4dab7e6ac7807a6d612  
12:04 <Denis2> has joined #xwiki  
12:04 <Denis> has quit  
12:05 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
12:08 <CIA-117> tmortagne master \* r381912d https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/381912d9cc0b006e199080a121f461b4ad90c92b / (6 files in 5 dirs): XWIKI-7880: Wiki Macro should require admin right for WIKI scope - http://git.io/2fMttQ  
12:09 <Denis2> has quit  
12:10 <vmassol> tmortagne: are you sure about this?  
12:10 <vmassol> I'd need to dig up the discussion thread but I thought it was done on purpose  
12:10 <+tmortagne> vmassol: yes I'm sure, that's even what the official document say and that's what it always supposed to be  
12:10 <vmassol> if you have edit rights then you can create documents anywhere in the wiki  
12:10 <+tmortagne> s/document/documentation/  
12:11 <+tmortagne> and ?  
12:11 <vmassol> ie docs for erverone  
12:11 <+tmortagne> what ?  
12:11 <vmassol> why couldn't you create macros for eveyrone?  
12:11 <+tmortagne> I don't understand what you mean  
12:11 <+tmortagne> what's tested is not edit right on the whole wiki  
12:12 <vmassol> for me it's normal that users with edit rights can register a macro for everyone to use  
12:12 <+tmortagne> it's edit right on the document you are creating  
12:12 <+tmortagne> don't mix global edit right and the fact to create a document  
12:12 <+tmortagne> you don't need to have edit right on the whole wiki to edit a document  
12:12 <vmassol> what you did is a bit anti wiki for me  
12:13 <vmassol> we want the max users to cerate macros for everyone  
12:13 <vmassol> with this only admins will be allowed  
12:13 <+tmortagne> then we should allow anyone to register global macro ?  
12:13 <vmassol> this is why I'm not sure  
12:13 <+tmortagne> it's the exact same logic  
12:13 <+tmortagne> again this is how it always supposed to be working and also how it's documented  
12:13 <vmassol> not anyone, only people who have rights to create pages  
12:14 <vmassol> I'm just saying that it's not so white and black for me  
12:14 <vmassol> what you've done is the safe thing to do  
12:15 <+tmortagne> vmassol: right now my concern is to be consistent with GLOBAL scope and to follow the official documentation. If you want to allow anyone to register a macro for any scope that a totally different subject.  
12:17 <vmassol> hmm I really don't get some of the changes done by caleb on the Evnrionment code  
12:17 <vmassol> initializing the temporary dir now requires to get the permanent dir and I don't understand why for ex  
12:17 <+tmortagne> indeed that sounds wrong said like this :)  
12:17 <vmassol> I've been spending so many hours just to try to understand this class now  
12:17 <vmassol> it's so complex  
12:19 <vmassol> that's because he checks if the temporary dir is not set inside the perm dir...  
12:19 <vmassol> not sure why he checks that though  
12:22 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
12:22 <vmassol> there's an infinite cycle btw  
12:23 <vmassol> maybe not, need to read more  
12:40 <CIA-117> Vincent Massol master \* r3a92f08 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/3a92f083a26986a8be9e880a3a89dcf6631f1c4c / (3 files in 3 dirs): [Misc] Fix minor bug where a NPE is thrown when the Servlet tmp dir doesn't ...  
12:49 <+sburjan> guys, the CI seems to be in a bad state.. some builds failed  
12:55 <rrodriguez> has quit  
13:00 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
13:04 <+tmortagne> sburjan: I think it's due to the wrong parent in the pom.xml, it's fixed now, just need to wait a full rebuit  
13:04 <+tmortagne> rebuild  
13:09 <Inge-> I'll try another question - is there a plugin or something built-in to display a table of contents based on the headers in a page, for quick navigation on that page?  
13:09 <+tmortagne> Inge-: {{toc/}}  
13:10 <+tmortagne> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/TOC+Macro  
13:14 <Inge-> Merci beaucoup!  
13:20 <mflorea> has quit  
13:20 <+tmortagne> Inge-: de rien  
13:26 <CIA-117> Vincent Massol master \* r891434a https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/891434ad305c7eda224f5a2b9fc91b9fa4cd4988 / (2 files): [Misc] Removing erroneous log: XWiki logs no longer go in a xwiki.log file - http://git.io/WKwQmw  
13:27 <CIA-117> tmortagne master \* r3bacf21 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-debug-eclipse/commit/3bacf21d7f1e82d48be55ccf07a14ae18e707562 / pom.xml : Upgrade to 4.2-SNAPSHOT - http://git.io/OGW\_1w  
13:27 <vmassol> errr do we have to merge all our changes?  
13:27 <vmassol> for 4.1-rc-1?  
13:28 <+tmortagne> vmassol: yes  
13:28 <vmassol> if so isn't it a bit early since 1) it wasn't announced and 2) RC1 has not been released  
13:28 <vmassol> did I miss the announcement?  
13:28 <+tmortagne> we usually create the branch just before releasing the first RC  
13:28 <vmassol> yep release is next Monday  
13:29 <+tmortagne> not sure if cjd announced the branch  
13:29 <vmassol> grrr  
13:29 <vmassol> so all the commits I've done are lost for 4.x… hmm  
13:29 <vmassol> I'm already late  
13:29 <+tmortagne> actually he did  
13:29 <vmassol> now I'll need to spend every time  
13:29 <vmassol> s/Every/even more  
13:29 <+tmortagne> ["WARNING] Release 2 days away, branching now, reply here if you need to commit to the release branch."  
13:29 <+tmortagne> you even answer to his mail ;)  
13:29 <vmassol> in a mail?  
13:29 <+tmortagne> answered  
13:29 <+tmortagne> yep  
13:29 <vmassol> I answered that I wasn't ready  
13:30 <vmassol> so I don't understand why he did it  
13:30 <vmassol> I asked him to not do it  
13:30 <+tmortagne> the release  
13:30 <+tmortagne> I think he just wanted to know what was planned in this branch  
13:30 <+tmortagne> just to know, not to block its creation  
13:37 <CIA-117> tmortagne master \* r37c5e66 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-debug-eclipse/commit/37c5e6699cfea06b3b4946ec68ec08361efdf2bf / .settings/org.eclipse.core.resources.prefs : Eclipse 4.2 stuff - http://git.io/GpwGkg  
13:43 <vmassol> hmm if we build commons with no profile and then rendering without profiles it fails  
13:43 <vmassol> that's because rendering-standalone uses commons legacy modules  
13:43 <vmassol> (I'm running with -o)  
13:44 <vmassol> I'm wondering if rendering-standalone shuldn't be in a profile  
14:00 <vmassol> has quit  
14:01 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:05 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:10 <vmassol> tmortagne: I get the following build failure on oldcore:  
14:10 <vmassol> Failed tests:   testSaveWikiMacro(com.xpn.xwiki.internal.macro.WikiMacrosTest): unexpected invocation: xWikiRightService.hasWikiAdminRights(<{originalWiki=xwiki, wiki=xwiki, org.xwiki.component.manager.ComponentManager=org.xwiki.component.embed.EmbeddableComponentManager@6e1f5438, mainxwiki=xwiki}>)(..)  
14:10 <vmassol> did I forget to update something?  
14:16 <+tmortagne> it's a oldcore test ?  
14:16 <vmassol> yes  
14:16 <+tmortagne> I may I forgotten to update oldcore tests, just took care of wikimacro tests  
14:16 <+tmortagne> looking at it  
14:19 <CIA-117> tmortagne master \* r0bf182f https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/0bf182f1209311e164ffdf2b627fa32473b11c6a / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/test/java/com/xpn/xwiki/internal/macro/WikiMacrosTest.java : XWIKI-7880: Wiki Macro should require admin right for WIKI scope - http://git.io/iUQ3Zw  
14:19 <+tmortagne> vmassol: should be ok now  
14:19 <vmassol> cool  
14:20 <vmassol> you're merging all this for 4.1 right?  
14:20 <vmassol> I think we'll need to do a review of all commits since cjd created the branch...  
14:20 <vmassol> just to be sure we haven't forgotten anything for 4.1  
14:33 <+tmortagne> vmassol: I'm not planning to merge it to 4.1 no, I find it a bit dangerous for an almost released version  
14:34 <vmassol> hmm ok, I thought you considered it an important issue/regression  
14:34 <+tmortagne> it's important yes but I would to wait a bit before backporting it to 4.1 branch  
14:35 <vmassol> ok...  
14:36 <+tmortagne> technically it's like that since a long time so it's not too critical in which version it's fixed  
  
{{/code}}
